author: Sagay Raj
title: Karnataka temple tax bill rejected in Legislative Council amid criticism by BJP - India Today
text: The Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowment bill which was passed in the Karnataka Assembly has been rejected at the Legislative CouncilA voice vote was conducted to decide on the bill and it received seven votes in its favour and 18 against it The bill mandates that the government will collect 10 per cent of the income of temples that have revenue of more than Rs 1 croreMuzrai Minister Ramalinga Reddy presented the bill at the Legislative Council on Friday sparking a heated discussion between BJP and Congress membersUltimately Deputy Chairperson of the council MK Pranesh conducted a voice vote and the bill was rejected After the bill was passed in the state Assembly on Wednesday the BJP criticised it alleging that the state government is involved in quotanti-Hindu policiesquot and there is bound to be misuse of the fundsChief Minister Siddaramaiah hit back at the BJP accusing it of ldquomisleading the publicrdquo for political gainsHe clarified that the amendment aims to increase the common pool fund Previously contributions came from specific income brackets and under the bill it would have been based on higher income thresholds to enhance the fundPublished By chingkheinganbi mayengbamPublished On Feb 24 2024Must Watch
